name: 509 U. S. 209 (1993)
court: Supreme Court of the United States

citations.name: Utah Pie
citations.court: Supreme Court of the United States
citations.reasoning: Reviewed the sufficiency of the evidence supporting jury verdicts against three national pie companies that had engaged in a variety of predatory practices in the market for frozen pies in Salt Lake City, with the intent to drive a local pie manufacturer out of business.

citations.name: Henry v. Chloride, Inc.
citations.court: United States Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit
citations.reasoning: Interpreted Utah Pie to permit liability for primary-line price discrimination on a mere showing that the defendant intended to harm competition or produced a declining price structure.

citations.name: D. E. Rogers Associates, Inc. v. Gardner-Denver Co.
citations.court: United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit
citations.reasoning: Interpreted Utah Pie to permit liability for primary-line price discrimination on a mere showing that the defendant intended to harm competition or produced a declining price structure.

citations.name: William Inglis & Sons Baking Co. v. ITT Continental Baking Co.
citations.court: United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit
citations.reasoning: Interpreted Utah Pie to permit liability for primary-line price discrimination on a mere showing that the defendant intended to harm competition or produced a declining price structure.

citations.name: Malcolm v. Marathon Oil Co.
citations.court: United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit
citations.reasoning: Interpreted Utah Pie to permit liability for primary-line price discrimination on a mere showing that the defendant intended to harm competition or produced a declining price structure.

citations.name: Pacific Engineering & Production Co. of Nevada v. Kerr-McGee Corp.
citations.court: United States Court of Appeals for the Tenth Circuit
citations.reasoning: Interpreted Utah Pie to permit liability for primary-line price discrimination on a mere showing that the defendant intended to harm competition or produced a declining price structure.

citations.name: International Telephone & Telegraph Corp.
citations.reasoning: Interpreted Utah Pie to permit liability for primary-line price discrimination on a mere showing that the defendant intended to harm competition or produced a declining price structure.

citations.name: 222 BROOKE GROUP LTD. v. BROWN & WILLIAMSON TOBACCO CORP.
citations.court: Supreme Court of the United States
citations.reasoning: Interpreted Utah Pie to permit liability for primary-line price discrimination on a mere showing that the defendant intended to harm competition or produced a declining price structure.

citations.name: Cargill, Inc. v. Monfort of Colorado, Inc.
citations.court: Supreme Court of the United States
citations.reasoning: Plaintiff seeking to establish competitive injury resulting from a rival's low prices must prove that the prices complained of are below an appropriate measure of its rival's costs.

citations.name: Matsushita Elec. Industrial Co. v. Zenith Radio Corp.
citations.court: Supreme Court of the United States
citations.reasoning: Plaintiff seeking to establish competitive injury resulting from a rival's low prices must prove that the prices complained of are below an appropriate measure of its rival's costs.

citations.name: Atlantic Richfield Co. v. USA Petroleum Co.
citations.court: Supreme Court of the United States
citations.reasoning: Exclusionary effect of prices above a relevant measure of cost either reflects the lower cost structure of the alleged predator, and so represents competition on the merits, or is beyond the practical ability of a judicial tribunal to control without courting intolerable risks of chilling legitimate price cutting.
